name: African Pride Pumba Private Game Reserve

reviews.text: My stay at Pumba Private Game Reserve was amazing! I am in definite agreement with many of the reviews posted on here. I stayed for 3 nights and every day was incredible. The staff was always eager to please and it seems they have thought of everything. We enjoyed having the hot chocolate waiting for us after every game drive....and even dropped in a bit of amarula to kick it up a notch.... the warm towels was a nice treat too. Enjoying cocktails and dinner next to a crackling fire was lovely. The menu choices included a little something for everyone. We never seemed to go hungry while at Pumba - another meal was always just around the corner!
reviews.title: Fantastic Experience!

reviews.text: Our ranger, Peter, was very knowledgeable and friendly. And...an excellent driver...even in the slick mud! We saw many different animals and Peter was very upfront of what we might not get to see. We did see 4 out of the Big Five and the white lions up close was a real treat!
reviews.title: Perfection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are amazing and very comfortable. After dinner you are escorted to your room by a ranger....the animals can access the property but we never felt unsafe....it just added to our wonderful safari experience! One of the elephants likes to visit on a regular basis and you can also see hippos in the water and on the river bank from your own deck or the deck of the main lodge. There are even binoculars to help with the viewing!
reviews.title: I could have cried....!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Two game drives a day; 3 meals a day; all beverages of wine and spirits included; crackling fires in the main lodge and in your own room; private plunge pool on your own deck; free wifi in the main lodge; warm blankets on your drives; animals everywhere; they will even do your laundry and have it returned to you after dinner. Pumba is an amazing place with excellent service. What an experience! Highly recommend!
reviews.title: october 2011

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at Pumba as part of the Lion World Tour, travel in style. Our agent, Cheryl (who is fantastic) booked my friend and I in the Water Lodge. We stayed for three nights and it was just perfection. Our room over looked the lake with Hippos. The pool was serene, the food was tasty and our ranger was fantastic. Sightings included: Lions, white lions, elephants, hippo, rhino. Only miss was the water buffalo which was fine with me!
reviews.title: Magic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Pumba for 4 nights and had an amazing time. We stayed at the Water Lodge and it was only half full which made it even more special. Alison and the staff looked after us extremely well. On the day we arrived our plunge pool was not working. Within an hour it was fixed and cleaned up. Any problems were addressed quickly and efficiently.
reviews.title: Perfect for peace and tranquility

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The games drives were excellent, our guide Peter was incredibly knowledgeable and had a special relationship with the animals. All drives were over two hours and the sundowners were a welcome surprise on the evening drives. Whilst we were there we experienced alot of rain, this didn't spoil the game drives at all, although if you sit at the front of the landrover you will get wet and we couldn't go along some of the tracks.
reviews.title: Magical!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is an extremely relaxing place to be, the staff are very attentive, nothing is too much trouble. Having the fires going in the evening was lovely, especially after a game drive in the rain, it was a treat to go back to our room and find the fire had been lit. The food is excellent, you will not go hungry at Pumba!
reviews.title: Great place to see Big 5!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only thing I would say is, it is a smaller game reserve so there weren't so many animals about, especially the lions. Equally there weren't so many holidaymakers either so we only came across 1 other vehicle when we were out.
reviews.title: Go wild in the Pumba! Save up though!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would we go back - definitely!
reviews.title: An amazing experience!
Really enjoyed our stay
reviews.text: We had a great couple of days at Pumba. It is a beautiful setting and the staff are very attentive. There is a huge disparity between the quality of the guides and this can have an effect on your time but all in all highly recommended.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is amazing. We were in the bush lodge for three night and the room was so beautiful- we visited the water lodge and it was fun to have a meal over there, but we preferred our room to the room we saw at the water lodge. Our guide (Justin) was so fun and knowledgeable and made each game drive really special. We were paired with another young couple for our game drives and it was really fun getting to know them. One morning we decided to do a game walk instead of a game drive and it was a neat experience- I would recommend. The food was really good and the service was the best we'd ever experienced. The game drives were amazing and we saw all of the big five except leopards, plus lots of other animals. It was only about 1.5 hours from Port Elizabeth and easy to find (there is a long dirt road that leads up to the entrance- at first we thought maybe we were lost, but we weren't- just keep going). We thought it was worth every penny, and actually a great value when you think about the cost of paying for food, great accommodations and game drives with a ranger. I did a lot of research before choosing this place and it seemed like the best deal with the best reviews and it exceeded all our expectations (which were really high). Maybe the coolest experience of our lives- go!
reviews.title: Perfect.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were here for three days (two nites) which seems about right. The accommodations in Msenge Bush Lodge were excellent. Spacious hardly describes the size of the rooms, the bath is the size of a bedroom with glass walls and freestanding shower and tub. The sleeping room was even larger. The wood stoked iron stove was wonderful romantic heating (there are conventional heating units also). All of the fittings were first class. There was a spacious deck surrounding the unit which we were too busy to make much use of, and a plunge pool which although equipped with jacuzzi style pumps was not heated and was a little too cool for us to use.
reviews.title: First Class Operation

reviews.text: The game drives were excellent. The guides knowledgeable and articulate. Ours discussed the flora and the fauna both which was appreciated. The tea or cocktail stops during the drives were much useful breaks. Although the food surprisingly was not anywhere as good as served in the lodge. There is some rough terrain, so be prepared to be bounced around a little.
reviews.title: The game is up

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food and beverage service was excellent. Good food, well prepared. The wine flowed like water and dinner with out large group soon became like a big family gathering. I never saw anyone in the bar, but the staff would make drinks on request.
reviews.title: Indescribable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only had the pleasure of spending 2 nights recently at the Pumba Private Game Reserve which I can only describe as being amazing. It was, without doubt, the highlight of our trip to South Africa.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.text: There are 2 types of lodge at Pumba – the water lodges and the bush lodges. We stayed in a water lodge which was situated in front of Lake Kareiga, a lake situated within the game reserve. The interior is very in keeping with its surroundings and yet at the same time manages to be luxurious. The front of our lodge had glass double doors which opened out onto a view of the lake and the Hippos bathing! Each lodge has a plunge pool but unfortunately it was too cold for us to dip into during our stay even though it did look very inviting. A complimentary mini bar is included, binoculars, a variety of wildlife books and they also provide a free laundry service. The bathroom is well stocked with toiletries and even has insect repellent just encase you can’t escape the smaller creatures in Pumba!
reviews.title: great accomodation and staff. More importantly, awesome safaris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our package was all inclusive; aside from the accommodation, food & beverages, 2 game drives per day are included in the price. When you consider the quality of the food served, the standard of accommodation and of course the game drives, it does actually represent good value for money. The food was divine and very plentiful with an excellent choice catering for all tastes. Let me tell you Pumba is not good for your waist line!!! Breakfast was gorgeous and really was something to look forward to after coming back from our morning game drive. Between 1.30 and 3 lunch was served after which we went on our 2nd game drive. On our return, between 5.30 – 6pm we were greeted with a glass of hot chocolate and hot towels. From 7pm dinner was served and once again the food was gorgeous and always presented beautifully.
reviews.title: A Perfect 5* Game Reserve

reviews.text: The owners of this game reserve are very fortunate to have extremely welcoming and helpful staff that also appear to be genuinely passionate about their work and the animals within the reserve. Simon, Loisya, Robert and Freedom to name but a few, really went to great lengths to ensure our stay was enjoyable and memorable. No matter what you asked of them nothing was a problem, they were always keen to help regardless of the hour, morning or night!
reviews.title: Just perfect in every way!

reviews.text: I can’t but give Pumba 5 stars even though we only spotted 2 out of the “Big 5” which was a disappointing result for us. Through no fault of Freedom, our ranger and guide who was truly excellent, the Buffalo, Leopard and the Rhino weren’t to be found. I think we were just plain unlucky and that this was the exception rather than the norm. From what I recall, Freedom has only managed to see the Leopard a handful of times in the wild, however we had hoped to see at least 4 of the “Big 5”. One has to bear in mind that this is a game reserve and not a zoo; thankfully these animals have the freedom to roam around and are not always willing to make an appearance purely for the satisfaction of the guests! Regardless, the white lion cubs more than made up for our disappointment, these 2 are the real stars in Pumba at the moment.
reviews.title: Love those little Pumbas

aka: Pumba Private Game Reserve Hotel Port Elizabeth
description: Discover wildest Africa in true luxury at Pumba Private Game Reserve & Spa in the malaria free Eastern Cape, South Africa. Our exclusive reserve has achieved gold status for its environmental responsibility, through The Green Leaf Initiative, and a 5-star rating for its exquisite accommodation facilities. With the formalities out of the way, African Pride Pumba Private Game Reserve accommodation at one of two intimate and enchanting lodges. Each idyllic chalet is totally private and complete with their own pools framed by timber decks and outdoor showers... only the monkeys and the hippos will be watching you here. Every chalet is designed and decorated using individual and natural fabrics - picking up on different aspects of African nature and wild life, and immersing you into feeling at one with the unspoilt beauty which surrounds you. When dining you'll be treated to an array of gourmet safari cuisine, all prepared by our passionate Five Star chefs, who will cater to all your individual needs. We have additional pampering for the mind, body, and soul, at the Msenge Bush Lodge's Soul Spa - as well as our fully equipped gym surrounded by glass, and extending out beneath a cathedral of trees. Come face to face with Africa’s Big 5 at African Pride Pumba Private Game. Visitors have the chance to experience the wonders of Africa - from the graceful giraffe to the seldom seen leopard. Don’t miss the once in a lifetime opportunity to see the very rare White Lions - 45 species of mammals and other small game. For the bird lovers and twitches the nearly 317 species occurring in our geographical region will never fail to delight you. This is the heart and soul of wildest Africa... this is African Pride Pumba Private Game Reserve.
